intro: Beta vulgaris var. depressalba, commonly known as the莙菜 or leaf beet, is a biennial plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves that are typically pale green to white in color, which distinguish it from other Beta species. The plant is native to Europe and has been cultivated for its edible leaves and roots. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species in both culinary and agricultural contexts.
